Interface FloatProperty

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Property, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface FloatProperty
extends Property
    Author:
    Moritz Lang

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getFloatValue()
      Returns the current value of the device property as a float.

      Returns the lower limit of this value.
      float getUpperLimit()
      Returns the upper limit of this value.

        float getFloatValue()
             throws MicroscopeException,
                    java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                    java.lang.InterruptedException,
                    java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the current value of the device property as a float.
        Returns:
        Value of property.
        Throws:
        MicroscopeException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown when value is not a float.
        java.lang.InterruptedException

       throws MicroscopeException,

      • setValueRelative

        void setValueRelative(float offset)
               throws MicroscopeException,
                      java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      MicroscopeLockedException,
                      java.lang.NumberFormatException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Sets the value of the microscope relative to its current value. Throws a NumberFormatException if the current value does not correspond to a float value.
        Parameters:
        offset - Amount for which the current value should be changed.
        Throws:
        MicroscopeException
        java.rmi.RemoteException
        MicroscopeLockedException
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - Thrown when current value is not a float.
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getLowerLimit

        float getLowerLimit()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the lower limit of this value. Returns Float.MIN_VALUE if this property does not have limits.
        Returns:
        Minimal value this property can have.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException

      • getUpperLimit

        float getUpperLimit()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Returns the upper limit of this value. Returns Float.MAX_VALUE if this property does not have limits.
        Returns:
        Maximal value this property can have.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException
